title: Beta testers sought!
content:
I am working on a new Keen game and some time within the next two weeks or so it will be ready for beta testing. I need a few volunteers: as long as you own a PC and have like half an hour of free time, you are qualified.

All who are interested should email me here:

extremereactionforce at yahoo dot com

Just for fun, here's a screencap:[img]http://img168.imageshack.us/img168/6425/tasterlw3.gif[/img]

title: ooh
content: I smell paralax scrolling... sign me up! My screenname at hotmail. Be sure to put something Keen in the subject, so I see it!

title: Re: ooh
content: You smell correctly! Check your email.

title: Re: ooh
content:
What's paralax scrolling?~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

title: Re: ooh
content:
i think it is when the background moves at a different rate to the front tiles as you move across the level, like it would in real life.
[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v499/Nevad/menbun.gif[/img]

Cute bunny!

content:

---Freeyorp

title: Re: ooh
content:
Hey, I just found an inconsistency in the 'perspective'. Some of the tilted lines are more tilted than others. You should be completely consistent with them and make them all tilted the same.____________
Don't think of me as an ordinary man.

Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]

title: Re: ooh
content:
DaVince: Good eye! Let me explain.


[img]http://img407.imageshack.us/img407/6545/taster1mj3.gif[/img]

There is a difference in angle between A and B because the original Keen 4 had the same type of discrepancy and I chose to preserve it.

There APPEARS to be a difference between C and B because none of the sides of the pillar are parallel to the flow of the platform. (When you see more graphics from that level it will make sense.)

title: Re: ooh
content:
Oh, so you mean that it's turned a bit? But in that case, it'd look a bit different anyway.

I'm not sure though, if you look at any random solid wall in the original Keens, it's pretty much all at the same angle. Funny how I never noticed that the perspective of moving platforms wasn't quite right, though... [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img] ____________
Don't think of me as an ordinary man.

Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]

title: Re: ooh
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]This application has failed to start because CNCS232.dll was not found. Re-installing the application may fix this problem.[hr][/quote]

[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img] Does anyone know where I can find it?

---Freeyorp

title: Re: ooh
content:
[url=http://www.google.com.au/search?hl=en&q=cncs232&btnG=Search&meta=]Magic[/url].

This is made with TGF?

title: Re: ooh
content:
No, MMF1.5. TGF uses cncs32.dll where MMF1 uses cncs232.dll. MMF 2 doesn't even use a DLL, it's inside the exe. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] ____________
Don't think of me as an ordinary man.

Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]

title: Re: ooh
content:
Ok, its working now.

I found a bug, in the first level I shot a bird mid air and it fell over, but it hung stunned in the air without falling.

---Freeyorp

title: Re: ooh
content:
also, In the help menu it says alt toggles pogo on and off when alt freezes the program (shift toggles pogo)

---Freeyorp

title: Re: ooh
content:
An old MMF bug, that could be fixed by fullscreening the game and using the Alt object.____________
Don't think of me as an ordinary man.

Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]

title: Re: ooh
content:
Doesn't Alt just freeze the game since it brings up the window menu? So it's not really an MMF bug, but a Windows annoyance.-Genius314
[url=http://planetck.spatang.com]PlanetCK[/url]

title: Re: ooh
content:
freeyorp101: Thanks for spotting that. Where was the bird stuck: at the edge of a piece of terrain, or just at a random spot in the air?

And sorry about that, try hitting shift instead of alt.

title: Re: ooh
content:
^The very bottom of a floor piece in the first level.

---Freeyorp

title: Re: ooh
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Doesn't Alt just freeze the game since it brings up the window menu? So it's not really an MMF bug, but a Windows annoyance.[hr][/quote]
Yes, but it stops doing that once you're fullscreening an app and don't make it have a menu. So to use alt successfully, don't have a menu, change the resolution mode, and use the alt object to read alt keypresses.____________
Don't think of me as an ordinary man.

Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]

title: Re: ooh
content: [quote]Quote:[hr]Doesn't Alt just freeze the game since it brings up the window menu? So it's not really an MMF bug, but a Windows annoyance.[hr][/quote]Actually, in C++ it's trivial to "capture" the Alt key, Windows doesn't treat it specially - so it is an MMF bug [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img]

title: ooh
content: sure, of course i'll do it, it would be great if i could. i have nothing important to do over the next few weeks anyway. i dont know the difference between alpha and beta testing, but im sure that wont affect me. so yeah, i wouldnt mind alpha testing for you.

title: Re: ooh
content: Beta testing is when you see how quickly you can break the program.  Alpha testing is when you see if you can do anything before it breaks on its own [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

title: ooh

title: Re: ooh
content:
I have two questions. What kind of game is this, and why does the SGA say long live Israel?

Anyway, it looks really cool, though I've never been found of new graphics replacing originals.
"Out of curiosity, what is that score in the Earth measurement system?"
"...That would be three hundred fifteen."
"Three hundred fifteen... This person must be the most intelligent being throughout the entire Universe." No one in the room had any immediate comment.
